project.teaser: CARE4BIO serves the needs for transnational cooperation between NCPs for Cluster 6 as well as for cross-cluster cooperation within Pillar 2, but also with other programme parts such as Widening Participation. We comprise a well-balanced network of 26 partners, including...
project.objective: CARE4BIO serves the needs for transnational cooperation between NCPs for Cluster 6 as well as for cross-cluster cooperation within Pillar 2, but also with other programme parts such as Widening Participation. We comprise a well-balanced network of 26 partners, including partners from the EU-13 and Associated Countries, combing all levels of relevant experience and expertise. Many of us fulfil multiple roles, for instance also working in NCP_WIDERA.NET, NCP Academy or EEN, different clusters and pillars, or appointed as programme coordinators. We are well set-up to deliver on our objectives, namely to (1) harmonise NCP services and increase their quality via transnational cooperation, (2) lower entry barriers for applicants, especially in less active member states and raise the quality of submitted proposals, (3) inform the European R&D community about cross-cutting synergies throughout Horizon Europe. To achieve this, we will cooperate with other (NCP) networks such as the ones mentioned above, to share knowledge and best practices, maximise efforts on informing NCPs, applicants and stakeholders, thereby raising the quality of proposals, breaking down silos, and encouraging trans-cluster collaboration. We will cooperate with the European Commission to assist in delivering upon political objectives such as the EU Green Deal, guiding applicants on policies, and providing feedback from our work as NCPs. We also offer concrete services for applicants, e.g., by organising yearly brokerage events to aid applicants in forming their own cooperation networks, and by supporting other matchmaking efforts. Our services will include training, learning resources, best practice manuals, policy briefings, and more. While our services will be available to whoever needs them, our focus is on NCPs and applicants from widening countries. Ultimately, our goal is to raise the general standard of support for potential applicants of Horizon Europe, contributing to increasing the quality

project.keywords: National Contact Points, CLuster 6, support Services, Networking services, Capacity building

result.title: Widening Strategy recommendations - Update 1
result.description: Deliverable of Task 2.1 This is the first update of the Widening strategy recommendations deliverable

result.title: Training Curriculum for applicants
result.description: Deliverable of Task 2.3 A training curriculum for applicants will be elaborated at M3 and regularly updated by APRE. This rolling plan will be essential to better understanding the HE target groups (especially new ones) and their needs, in order to offer adequate training materials and guidance.

result.title: Training Curriculum for applicants- Update 1
result.description: Deliverable of Task 2.3 First update of the training curriculum for applicants.

result.title: Publication and update of Stakeholders Map- Update 1
result.description: Deliverable of Task 3.4 First update of the stakeholders map

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Strategy - Update 1
result.description: Deliverable of Task 4.1 First update of Communication and Dissemination Strategy.

result.title: Online Database with relevant EU policies/strategies - Update 2
result.description: Deliverable of Task 3.3 Second update of the online database with relevant EU policies/strategies.

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Strategy
result.description: Deliverable of Task 4.1 Communication and Dissemination Strategy will contain a detailed description of all communication and dissemination activities (such as identification of relevant stakeholders and their respective information needs, communication goals, main messages and timelines). The C&D strategy and its KPIs will remain a living document and revisited and updated during the project’s lifetime.

result.title: Training Curriculum for applicants - Update 2
result.description: Deliverable of Task 2.3 Second update of the training curriculum for applicants.

result.title: Online Database with relevant EU policies/strategies
result.description: Deliverable of Task 3.3 An online database of policies/directives relevant to Cluster 6 will be developed and updated annually . This database will be uploaded in the project’s website where all NCPs can have access.

result.title: Publication and update of Stakeholders Map
result.description: Deliverable of Task 3.4 The stakeholder map will include key stakeholders of Cluster 6 (Missions, EuropeanPartnerships, Synergistic programmes such as EIP Agri, LIFE, EIT-KICs, COST, EJP Soil, JRC, ERA-LEARN, key initiatives funded within the work-programme of Cluster 6, etc.).

result.title: Online Database with relevant EU policies/strategies - Update 1
result.description: Deliverable of Task 3.3 First update of online database with relevant EU policies/strategies.

result.title: "Updated Public E-booklet ""Good practices for EEN-NCP Collaboration"""
result.description: Deliverable of Task 3.2 Through NCP-EEN collaboration (pairing, prividing tools, guidance) the public e-booklet of good practices from NCPs CaRE and including inputs from BioHorizon and webinars (for EEN advisers and vice versa for NCPs) will be updated.

result.title: Widening Strategy recommendations
result.description: Deliverable of Task 2.1 The deliverable will include analysing existing barriers for participation, as well as strategies, policies, outcomes of the previous projects and EU workshops to set up updated recommendations in this area for Cluster 6.

result.title: Training Curriculum for applicants- Update 3
result.description: Deliverable of Task 2.3 Third update of the training curriculum for applicants.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
